project_objectives.overall_mission: Offering young people spaces and tools to regain balance, awareness, and the capacity to act in an increasingly fragmented context.
project_objectives.genesis: Born from Youth Exchange 'Green, Sustainable and Healthy Living' in Denmark (2024), where Italian and Macedonian youth recognized the deep connections between mental health, misinformation, mobility, and sustainability.
project_objectives.approach: Using the human body as a metaphor to explore interconnections and transform them into learning and action.

smart_objectives.title: Identity & Intercultural Awareness
smart_objectives.objective: Increase identity and intercultural awareness, deconstructing stereotypes through body mapping and creating shared guidelines.
smart_objectives.target: At least 80% of participants develop a deeper understanding of differences.

smart_objectives.title: European Belonging & Mobility
smart_objectives.objective: Develop a sense of European belonging by exploring mobility and tracing personal and family migration stories.
smart_objectives.target: 75% of participants feel 'more European' at the end of the experience.

smart_objectives.title: Sustainable Food Practices
smart_objectives.objective: Promote concrete sustainable food practices, such as km0 cooking and carbon footprint calculation.
smart_objectives.target: 70% of participants modify their habits and 100% formulate a personal commitment.

metrics.success_criteria: 70% adopt new practices, 100% commit to change

smart_objectives.title: Emotional Intelligence & Resilience
smart_objectives.objective: Improve emotional intelligence skills by providing emotion management and resilience tools.
smart_objectives.target: 85% of participants acquire at least 2 new self-regulation techniques.

smart_objectives.title: Critical Thinking & Media Literacy
smart_objectives.objective: Strengthen critical thinking and media literacy through fact-checking labs.
smart_objectives.target: 80% of participants can identify at least 3 signs of online disinformation.

smart_objectives.title: Civic Action & Local Impact
smart_objectives.objective: Transform learning into civic action, supporting each national team in developing a local action plan.
smart_objectives.target: All 8 teams create action plans and realize at least one multiplier event within three months.

metrics.measurement: Documented action plans + multiplier events reports
metrics.success_criteria: 8/8 teams complete action plans, 8/8 organize events (min 160 total reach)

smart_objectives.title: Holistic Learning Recognition
smart_objectives.objective: Recognize acquired learning in a holistic vision, ensuring all participants receive Youthpass certification.
smart_objectives.target: 100% of participants receive their Youthpass certificate.

eu_youth_goals.title: Inclusive Societies
eu_youth_goals.connection: Day 1 (The Skin) addresses identity, stereotypes, and diversity through body mapping and intercultural workshops. With 50% participants with fewer opportunities, inclusion is at the core.

eu_youth_goals.title: Information and Constructive Dialogue
eu_youth_goals.connection: Day 5 (The Head) develops media literacy with fact-checking labs and News Factory simulation. Responds to 76% of youth encountering disinformation and 34% considering it the main threat to democracy.

eu_youth_goals.title: Mental Health and Wellbeing
eu_youth_goals.connection: Day 4 (The Heart) offers emotional awareness tools, Theatre of the Oppressed, and mindfulness. Nearly 50% of European youth report emotional difficulties.

eu_youth_goals.title: Moving Rural Youth Forward
eu_youth_goals.connection: Participation of youth from rural areas (Romania, Portugal, North Macedonia) reduces geographic isolation through mobility. NEET rate in rural areas: 12.3% vs 11.0% EU average.

eu_youth_goals.title: Space and Participation for All
eu_youth_goals.connection: Day 6 (The Hands) creates real spaces for active citizenship and participatory decision-making, connecting international experience to concrete territorial actions through 8 Local Multiplier Events.

eu_youth_goals.title: Sustainable Green Europe
eu_youth_goals.connection: Day 3 (The Stomach) combines sustainability and food with carbon footprint calculation, km0 cooking, and zero-waste practices. 85% of EU citizens demand climate priority, 33% of youth list environment as a priority.

erasmus_priorities.name: Inclusion and Diversity
erasmus_priorities.description: 50% of participants face economic, geographical, or social barriers. Inclusive methodologies (body expression, art, movement) don't require high language skills. Venue is accessible with budget support for specific needs.

erasmus_priorities.name: Environmental Sustainability
erasmus_priorities.description: Beyond Day 3, sustainable practices permeate the entire exchange: green travel, km0 meals, paperless workflow, daily zero-waste challenge.

erasmus_priorities.name: Digital Transformation
erasmus_priorities.description: Day 5 addresses media literacy and digital citizenship. Participants use digital tools for preparation, documentation, and dissemination, developing a critical relationship with technology.

erasmus_priorities.name: Participation in Democratic Life
erasmus_priorities.description: Youth-led approach, participatory decision-making processes, and design of local actions translate democratic values into concrete practices through Local Multiplier Events.
